abstract: Despite heavy lobbying by the company, workers at the facility voted by a wide margin for a union. It was seen as a rebuke of the company’s treatment of its employees.
snippet: Despite heavy lobbying by the company, workers at the facility voted by a wide margin for a union. It was seen as a rebuke of the company’s treatment of its employees.
lead_paragraph: It was a union organizing campaign that few expected to have a chance. A handful of employees at Amazon’s massive warehouse on Staten Island, operating without support from national labor organizations, took on one of the most powerful companies in the world.

headline.main: Amazon Workers on Staten Island Vote to Unionize in Landmark Win for Labor
headline.print_headline: Amazon Workers on Staten Island Give Unions a Surprise Win

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union

byline.original: By Karen Weise and Noam Scheiber
